content.body: I do sympathize with yulia's point of `import module` potentially being confusing to a regular developer, who would naturally think that they have always been importing "modules" but now there is this thing called `import module` that does something different.

content.body: Separately, I really like the idea of building a topology of the ongoing proposals and similarly a capability graph. I think they would be massively helpful to anyone like me who's getting into this space.

content.body: Module is one of _those words_. Mark Miller insists that nothing should be called _module_ because so many things could be called modules when you strip off the qualifiers.

content.body:
> <@kriskowal:matrix.org> I also could buy `import x from 'y' as module`, but that doesn‚Äôt address the ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs a module? i thought _module_ was a synecdoche of _module exports namespace exotic objects_.‚Äù

Yes, and it means that `as identifier` means two different things *in import statements* (even worse than when it was `as "string"`)
